title: Record-breaking Salt helps England to historic win against South Africa
summary: Phil Salt hits 141 while Jos Buttler adds 83 as England score 304-2 - their highest ever total in a T20 international - before bowling South Africa out for 158, to ease to an historic win at Old Trafford in the second T20 and level the series at 1-1.

title: Wigan thump Castleford to clinch top-two finish
summary: Wigan Warriors clinch a Super League top-two finish and a home semi-final with an 11-try win against lowly Castleford Tigers.

title: Leigh seal home play-off spot with win over Saints
summary: Leigh Leopards guarantee a home play-off tie with a 28-10 victory against St Helens that secures a top-four finish.

title: Century for Salt on record-breaking night for England
summary: Phil Salt scores England's fastest T20 century on a record-breaking night at Old Trafford as the hosts level the series with an 146-run win over South Africa.

title: 'Breathtaking batting' - Salt hits record-breaking 141 for England
summary: Phil Salt hits a record-breaking, unbeaten 141 from 60 balls, the highest individual T20 score by an England cricketer, to guide the home side to a huge 146-run win against South Africa in the second T20 at Old Trafford.

title: Everton eye bargain Grealish deal - Saturday's gossip
summary: Everton hopeful of signing Manchester City's Jack Grealish for less than ยฃ50m, Manchester United, Liverpool and Chelsea chase Crystal Palace's Adam Wharton, Fulham consider Harry Wilson future, plus more.

title: Norrie & Fery put GB in control in Davis Cup tie
summary: Cameron Norrie and Arthur Fery won their Davis Cup matches to give Great Britain a 2-0 lead over Poland and a strong chance of reaching next year's qualifiers.

title: Rose among Ryder-Cup bound trio in contention at BMW PGA
summary: Japan's Hideki Matsuyama cards a superb 64 to lead after the second round of the BMW PGA Championship - with Ryder Cup-bound trio Justin Rose, Ludvig Aberg and Viktor Hovland all in contention.

title: 'Magnificent' Buttler innings puts England on course for huge total
summary: Jos Buttler hits 83 runs off 30 balls, including seven sixes, to give England an incredible start, moving them to 126-1 inside eight overs in the second T20 against South Africa at Old Trafford.

title: Ripped Crawford weighs same as champion Canelo
summary: A shredded Terence Crawford - jumping up two divisions - weighed the same as champion Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez for Saturday's Las Vegas super-fight.

title: Salt gets England off to smashing start against South Africa
summary: Phil Salt hits three fours and a six off Marco Jansen to get England off to a flying start with a score of 18-0 after the first over in the second T20 at Old Trafford.

title: Philipsen beats Pedersen to win stage 19 of Vuelta
summary: Belgium's Jasper Philipsen wins stage 19 of the Vuelta a Espana in an uphill bunch sprint as Jonas Vingegaard increases his lead in the general classification.

title: Rodgers calls for 'cowardly' insider to leave Celtic
summary: Brendan Rodgers calls for a club investigation to uncover the "cowardly" insider who briefed against the Celtic boss to a national newspaper.

title: Rodgers calls for 'cowardly' insider to leave Celtic
summary: Brendan Rodgers calls for a club investigation to uncover the "cowardly" insider who briefed against the Celtic boss to a national newspaper.

title: Palace boss Glasner 'never threatened' to resign over Guehi
summary: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner says "he never threatened to leave" the club over the potential sale of captain Marc Guehi to Liverpool on transfer deadline day.

title: Canelo v Crawford - all you need to know
summary: All you need to know about Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez's fight with Terence Crawford in Las Vegas.

title: 133-cap Ireland and Lions scrum-half Murray retires
summary: Former Ireland and British and Irish Lions scrum-half Conor Murray confirms his retirement from rugby after opting against a move abroad.

title: 'A win will make me one of the greatest of all time'
summary: Terence Crawford speaks to BBC Sport before his fight with Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez in Las Vegas.

title: Full-back Lewis extends Man City deal until 2030
summary: Manchester City full-back Rico Lewis signs a new contract that will keep him at the club until the summer of 2030.

title: Pereira to become youngest woman to fight in UFC
summary: Brazil's Alice Pereira, 19, is set to become the youngest woman in history to fight in the UFC when she faces Montserrat Rendon at UFC Noche on Saturday.

title: Late Scotland call-up Belisle to start quarter-final with England

title: T20 Finals Day: Big guns, powerhouses and underdogs
summary: Lancashire, Somerset, Northamptonshire and Hampshire head to Edgbaston hoping to emerge as T20 Blast winners in 2025.

title: Bayindir keeps Man Utd spot after Lammens' arrival
summary: Altay Bayindir will retain his place in goal for Manchester United in Sunday's derby against City - but head coach Ruben Amorim says Senne Lammens could be first choice "for a number of years".

title: Saka & Saliba want to be part of future - Arteta
summary: Mikel Arteta says Bukayo Saka and William Saliba "want to be a big part of Arsenal's future" as talks about new contracts for the pair continue.

title: Match of the Day
summary: Behind the scenes at Match of The Day.

title: Kerr 'very confident' for 1500m defence in Tokyo
summary: "I'm here to win," is the simple message from Josh Kerr as he prepares to defend his 1500m title at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title: 'We need a big presence' - Guardiola on keeper dilemma
summary: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says "everyone will be involved" this season as he weighs up his starting goalkeeper for Sunday's derby against Manchester United.

title: Players 'exhausted' by 'unrelenting' schedule - ECB chief
summary: Cricket must "look at the schedule" of a "relentless" calendar, with some players "exhausted", says ECB chairman Richard Thompson.

title: Coach Powell suspended over safeguarding concern

title: England captain Aldcroft returns to face Scotland
summary: England captain Zoe Aldcroft has recovered from injury start the Red Roses' Women's Rugby World Cup quarter-final against Scotland on Sunday in Bristol.

summary: Dana White has a robust exchange with reporter Sean Zittel at the Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez v Terence Crawford news conference in Las Vegas, regarding the Muhammad Ali Act and the UFC CEO's venture into boxing.
